intro: Melanthera albinervia subsp. acuminata, commonly known as the white-veined melanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with prominent white veins. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it blooms during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats.
